snippet: A man was charged today with threatening to set fires in revenge for the Government seizure of his property. But prosecutors said they had not linked him to recent fires in Southern California.    The man, Thomas Lee Larsen, 43, was arrested on Su...
lead_paragraph: A man was charged today with threatening to set fires in revenge for the Government seizure of his property. But prosecutors said they had not linked him to recent fires in Southern California. The man, Thomas Lee Larsen, 43, was arrested on Sunday and charged today in Federal District Court with one count of mailing threats to damage or destroy by means of fire. The charge carries a maximum penalty of five years in prison and a $250,000 fine.

headline.main: U.S. ARRESTS MAN IN FIRE THREATS
